snippet: Hoping to win a six-month extension of protection from generic competition, the maker of OxyContin is renewing a clinical trial.
abstract: Purdue Pharma, maker of the widely abused narcotic painkiller OxyContin, is renewing a clinical trial of the drug's use in children; Purdue is hoping to use the study to obtain a lucrative six-month extension of OxyContin's protection from generic competition, making use of a 1990s law that rewards drug makers for conducting clinical studies involving children.
lead_paragraph: Hoping to win a six-month extension of protection from generic competition, the maker of OxyContin is renewing a clinical trial.

headline.seo: OxyContin’s Effect on Children in Testing by Purdue Pharma
headline.main: After Delay, OxyContin’s Use in Young Is Under Study
